info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 9 at 4:11PM EST until November 11 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Gaylord MI
info.description:
* WHAT...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations up to one inch. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 3 and 6 inches near the Lake Michigan shoreline in Manistee county. Locally higher amounts will be possible around Manistee.
* WHERE...Western Manistee County.
* WHEN...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, until 7 PM EST this evening. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, from 7 AM Monday to 1 AM EST Tuesday.
* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning and evening commutes. Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous.
info.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.
Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving. If you are going outside, watch your first few steps taken on stairs, sidewalks, and driveways. These surfaces could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
During lake effect snow, the weather can vary from bands of locally heavy snow to dry weather just a few miles away. Visibilities can also vary greatly. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather, visibility, and road conditions.

parameter.value: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM MONDAY TO 1 AM EST TUESDAY
